posts.title: When the drugs don’t work | The Economist
posts.content:
http://www.economist.com/news/leaders/21699116-how-combat-dangerous-rise-antibiotic-resistance-when-drugs-dont-work

You have a sore throat?

Take antibiotics in case it is bacterial. If it is viral, and hence untreatable by drugs, no harm done—except to someone else who later catches a resistant infection.

The lack of an incentive to do the right thing is hard to correct. In some health-care systems, doctors are rewarded for writing prescriptions. Patients suffer no immediate harm when they neglect to complete drug courses after their symptoms have cleared up, leaving the most drug-resistant bugs alive. Because many people mistakenly believe that human beings, not bacteria, develop resistance, they do not realise that they are doing anything wrong.

posts.title: Rômulo Barral 3: AJ
posts.content:
Thank you my brother @thefloridaboy fpr the kind words is mean a lot for me bro. Obrigado meu irmao Aj pelas palavras , isso representa muito para mim. #TTCB repost: @metamoris • @TheFloridaBoy TAKEOVER This is me training with IBJJF hall of fame inductee, many many time world champion, ADCC champion, and all around major bad ass @romulobarral in Northridge, CA I travel a lot, but focus the majority of my training to be with Romulo at @gbnorthridge as much as I can. He is a person that truly upholds the values of a martial artist. Discipline, integrity, respect, perseverance, and patience. A champion isn't just someone who does it part time, when he feels good, or when someone is watching. It is a result of diligence for many years. A long solitary road of diligence. It's great to have someone real like Romulo to look up to in this sport, both on and off the mats. TAG someone that inspires you! #GracieBarra #IronSharpensIron #JiuJitsu 📷 ——> @shotjunkie

A photo posted by Romulo Barral (@romulobarral) on Jan 11, 2016 at 5:31pm PST

posts.title: Rômulo Barral 2: Jacob Harman
posts.content:
I'm pretty sure I know how this went down: knowing Romulo, and how he loves to bless his students with huge, heartfelt surprises…… I'm sure both Gabriel and Felipe walked out to the mat thinking that they were going to close out to Romulo, as would be expected for the student to honor his teacher in this tradition. I imagine that somewhere between the table and the center of the mat, Romulo whispered to the judge to raise his student's hand instead of his. The joy on the face of both Felipe and Gabriel says it all. It's what coaches live for…..This indescribable joy that can only be found when a huge goal is accomplished, a journey completed, when a dream turns into reality. It's absolutely priceless. I'm so happy for all three of champions. This is part of what makes Romulo Barral an amazing professor and a great man. Not only will his legacy include his amazing style of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, hard work, and dedication…… but all of his students have been touched and imprinted with his golden heart, honor, and gratitude. May all of these attributes be part of his legacy forever. #RomuloBarral #Lenda #Legado #GloryToGod #Repost @janainabarral with @repostapp. ・・・ I am so proud of you @romulobarral He won 7 fights by submission in less than 5 min and gave both of his titles weight and open weight to his students. #TRUELEGEND #barrallegend #proudwife #teamtcb #Repost @edwinnajmi with @repostapp. ・・・ Show me another person in jiujitsu that would make it to the finals and give both titles to his students —> living legend, true champion. #barrallegacy

A photo posted by Jacob Harman (@jacobharman) on Jan 25, 2016 at 11:55am PST
posts.excerpt: I'm pretty sure I know how this went down: knowing Romulo, and how he loves to bless his students with huge, heartfelt surprises…… I'm sure both Gabriel and Felipe walked out to the mat thinking that they were going to close out to Romulo, as would be expected for the student to honor his teacher […]

posts.title: Rômulo Barral 1: Draculino
posts.content:
Great results for @graciebarratx and @gracebarrabh this past weekend. Roberto Sanchez put on a show on his legacy fight against the undefeated David Acosta. Robert dominated and submitted on the third round. Dana White and Matt Serra got really impressed with "little fury." On the Europeans, GBBH's very own @romulobarral @carlosterrinha and @felipepenabjj put on a show on the black belt division. Romulo and "Preguica" closed the absolute black belt adult division and Terrinha won the masters 4 Absolute. More important than the results was the attitude and honor displayed by Romulo. Even though he was the senior of the black belts, he gave the victory to Preguiça and his student Gabriel on the finals. This shows that besides being one of the biggest champions in the sport's history, he is a man who embodies the samurai spirit, living and dying by the sword and the code of honor. Very proud to have a student who is a champion but more importantly a good man. OSS! #graciebarra #gbbh #gbpearland #gbtexas #houstonbjj #honor #loyalty #romulobarral

A photo posted by Vinicius Draculino (@draculinobjj) on Jan 25, 2016 at 3:14pm PST

posts.title: Copa Pódio countdown: Durinho X Gracie
Countdown to Copa Pódio: fight schedule
posts.content:
Guess what was released yesterday? The schedule for the fights on January 9th!

Para português, acesse aqui diretamente. 

18:00 Luta de Abertura

The site www.flograppling.com will broadcast the event exclusively from 3:00 pm (New York time).

 

1:30 pm Opening the acces gates to the gym
3:00 Opening Fight Max Gimenis (GFTeam RJ) X Rafael Teófilo (Nova União CE)
 

1ª ROUND GP
3:20 PM Green Davi Ramos (BRA) X Lucas Lepri (BRA)
Green Felipe Silva (BRA) X AJ Sousa (USA)
Yellow Edwin Najmi (USA) X Dillon Danis (USA)
Yellow Diego Borges (BRA) X Luan Carvalho (BRA)
 

2ª ROUND GP
3:50 PM Green Lucas Lepri (BRA) X Felipe Silva (BRA)
Green Davi Ramos (BRA) X Leandro Lo ( BRA)
Yellow Dillon Danis (USA) X Diego Borges (BRA)
Yellow Edwin Najmi (USA) X Jaime Canuto (BRA)
 

3ª ROUND GP
4:20 Green Felipe Silva (BRA) X Davi Ramos (BRA)
Green Leando Lo (BRA) X AJ Sousa (USA)
Yellow Diego Borges (BRA) X Edwin Najmi (USA)
Yellow Jaime Canuto (BRA) X Luan Carvalho (BRA)
 

4ª ROUND GP
5:05 PM Green AJ Sousa (USA) X Davi Ramos (BRA)
Green Lucas Lepri (BRA) X Leandro Lo ( BRA)
Yellow Luan Carvalho (BRA) X Edwin Najmi (USA)
Yellow Dillon Danis (USA) X Jaime Canuto (BRA)
 

5ª ROUND GP
5:35 Green Felipe Silva (BRA) X Leandro Lo ( BRA)
Green Lucas Lepri (BRA) X AJ Sousa (USA)
Yellow Diego Borges (BRA) X Jaime Canuto (BRA)
Yellow Dillon Danis (USA) X Luan Carvalho (BRA)
 

CHALLENGE – VIKINGS VS CABRAS DA PESTE (1ª Stage)
6::20 PM 1ª Fight Espen Mathiesen (NOR) X Yan Pica-Pau (Ceará)
2ª Fight Tommy Langaker (NOR) X Rafael Vasconcelos (Ceará)
3ª Fight Ida Floisvik (NOR) X Kessy Pereira (Paraíba)
 

SEMI-FINALS
7:00 PM Fight 1 1º lugar Grupo Verde X 2º lugar Grupo Amarelo
Fight 2 1º lugar Grupo Amarelo X 2º lugar Grupo Verde
 

SUBMISSION CHALLENGE MATCH
7:20 PM Middle Heavy David Vieira (BRA) X Robson Gracie (BRA)
 

FINALS
7:30 PM 3º PLACE Loser of Fight 1 X Loser of Fight 2
7:40 FINAL Winner of Fight 1 X Winner of Fight 2

posts.title: Copa Pódio countdown: heavyweight finals
posts.content:
This is from 2015 Grand Prix, where Felipe (GB) faced Luiz Panza. Our GB colleague kept his crown for Copa Pódio, one of the most amazing competitions out there!

Check it out in my Instagram shot below:

Countdown for Copa Pódio in January 9th… So happy to be able to join some of the most creative and exciting matches of recent Jiu Jitsu history! I hope I'll be able to some of these Monsters on the mat! This is short video is from last heavy weight championship, the champion Preguica against Panza! 😎👍 #copapodio #heavyweight #jiujitsu #cascagrossa #riodejaneiro #brasileiros #brasil #brasuca #bjj #monsters #fight #impressive #exciting #winner #finals #gold

A video posted by Daniel Rio de Janeiro (@danielriodejaneiro) on Dec 13, 2015 at 7:56pm PST
